term.name: Access level
term.definition: The level of access, such as administrative or read only, that a credential has for a particular service. Access levels can only be set for related logins.

term.name: Credential
term.definition: Refers to an incomplete public (username only), incomplete private (password only), or complete credential pair. A credential can have a realm, but it is not a requirement.

term.name: Login
term.definition: A credential pair that is associated with a particular service on a host. A login can be used to attempt to authenticate to a service.

term.name: Origin
term.definition: The source of the credential. The origin refers to how the credential was obtained or added to the project. Credentials can be manually added, imported, collected from a session, or obtained from a service.

term.name: Realm
term.definition: A realm refers to the functional grouping of database schemas to which the credential belongs. A realm type can be a domain name, a Postgres database, a DB2 database, or an Oracle System Identifier (SID).

term.name: Private
term.definition: A password, SSH key, NTLM hash, or nonreplayable hash.

term.name: Validated credential
term.definition: An incomplete public, incomplete private, or complete credential pair that was used to successfully authenticate to a target.
